projects.title: EVS in the Hague 2014 Leaflet
projects.description: This is a joint project between EVS (European Voluntary Service) volunteers at two organisations in the Hague. We have prepared a short leaflet with general information about the programme. The leaflet also contains our personal observations about the Dutch EVS experience.

projects.title: Young European Council
projects.description: I was a media delegate in the Education to Employment panel at the first Young European Council which took place between the 20th and the 23rd of October 2014 and was hosted by the European Commission, the Council of the European Union and the European Parliament. I was responsible for the comprehensive real-time coverage of the event on social media and the creation of a database of European press contacts.

contributors.headline: Linguistics graduate using data analysis for process improvements

projects.title: News in Levels
projects.description: I undertook an online project with News in Levels as an ELT assistant and materials developer in 2014. I  summarised Daniel Defoe's classic novel "Robinson Crusoe" and adapted it to intermediate English language learners. Since then I have continued to collaborate with the News in Levels team as an editor of the new online project People in Levels.

contributors.headline: Linguistics graduate using data analysis for process improvements

projects.title: Research project "Young People's Engagement with European Media"
projects.description: Since the beginning of 2014 I and my colleague Lida Aslanidou have been developing an EEMP project (European Exchange of Media Practices) in the frame of the EU/Council of Europe joint MEDIANE Programme. We look into young people's engagement with European media from three perspectives. Our main research question is how young people aged 18-30 engage, produce and follow media in the United Kingdom and Bulgaria. The project concludes with a short documentary film, which has been filmed in London and Cambridge in June 2014 and in Sofia in July 2014.

projects.title: "Steps of Dialogue" Youth Exchange, Nurri, Sardinia, Italy
projects.description: "Steps of Dialogue" is a youth exchange which brought together young people from Malta, Slovenia, Bulgaria, the Netherlands, Hungary and Latvia. The main objective of the exchange was the creation of a shared creative space to fight discrimination through the universal language of dance.

projects.title: "Fix with the Moment" Youth Exchange, Vilnius, Lithuania
projects.description: "Fix with the Moment" is a multilateral youth exchange on the topic of photography and social media. 30 posters on solutions to common youth problems were produced at the end of it. These can be seen in the Soul Box cafe in Vilnius in October, and later in a traveling exhibition in Lithuania.

projects.title: Yes We Can! European Youth Leadership Training, Pogradec, Albania.
projects.description: Yes We Can! Is a training course for youth workers and youth leaders focused on facilitating international and intercultural youth encounters. The aim of this training course is to train youth workers, youth leaders involved in youth organisations and services in facilitating youth exchanges for  EU and South-East Europe youth.

courses.name: Global Education: The Human Rights Dimension
Puertas Abiertas: Curso de español para necesidades inmediatas (I)

profile_positions.description: In this position I'm providing admin support for the HR systems used at Van Oord. These include the learning management systems, the system used for hiring temporary (project) personnel and the applicant tracking system. I'm part of a workgroup focusing on promoting IT security awareness. Parallel to that, I fulfil the function of departmental IT coordinator and monitor the P&O Systems team tasks and communication.
profile_positions.title: PO Systems Officer

profile_positions.description: As a Quality and Training analyst, I was reviewing the quality of the customer service provided over the phone or in written form in English, Italian, German and Dutch. Analysing the results, I was able to identify training opportunities and propose working solutions to improve the support teams' performance, internal processes and the overall customer experience.
profile_positions.title: Quality and Training Analyst

profile_positions.description: In this dynamic position, I handled incoming calls and written requests from customers. Wanting the best possible experience for colleagues and clients alike, I focused on finding better and faster ways to complete routine tasks. Within months of joining the company, I was suggesting improvements in the internal and front-facing systems. In early 2016 I won the Sofia office's "Employee of the Quarter" award for excellent productivity metrics, customer service achievements and contributions to the company's objectives.
profile_positions.title: Customer Support Representative with Italian and English

profile_positions.description: I have been a regular contributor and conference reporter for E&M. My topics of interest include, but are not limited to, youth participation and activism, human rights, social trends, sex and gender theory, education and culture, social entrepreneurship.
profile_positions.title: Author

profile_positions.description: Editor-in-chief of the English version of "UNO, You know?!", a bilingual student blog on international affairs. I initiated an expansion of the contributor's team beyond Geneva and we recruited in the US and in several European countries. The blog's visibility increased and it had at least one post in English every month. The recruitment strategy proved successful as some of the journalists I invited took over editing the blog after my term ended.
profile_positions.title: English editor-in-chief of "UNO, You know?!"

company.name: The Hague Institute for Global Justice

profile_positions.company: The Hague Institute for Global Justice
profile_positions.description: I created and updated the content and appearance of the Institute’s website and social media channels while also editing texts for the biannual magazine "Intersections".  Halfway through my internship, I organised and delivered a social media training for researchers. To measure the outreach, I introduced an evaluation system for social media performance which was updated on a monthly basis and allowed for testing new communication methods.
profile_positions.title: Events and Communications Intern

profile_positions.description: I furthered the work of the organisation by translating core documents on gender equality and human rights from Bulgarian to English and vice versa.
profile_positions.title: Translation Assistant

company.name: EU/ Council of Europe MEDIANE programme

profile_positions.company: EU/ Council of Europe MEDIANE programme
profile_positions.description: I took part in a two-year training programme for  journalists and media practitioners organised by the EU/ Council of Europe. MEDIANE (Media in Europe for Diversity Inclusiveness) programme fostered recognising diversity in the media and supported individual research projects which were later used to create a database of good practices and case studies.
profile_positions.title: Youth & Media Researcher

profile_positions.description: During my EVS, I introduced a new communications and public relations strategy, organised public film screenings and debates, edited an e-book on the topic of migration in Europe and updated the organisation’s website. I also wrote a study visit project on the topic of human rights.
profile_positions.title: Community Development Programme Coordinator, European Voluntary Service

profile_positions.location: Dipartimento di Studi Umanistici, Università degli Studi di Trieste
profile_positions.description: I delivered the closing speech at the 7th World Youth Forum "Right to Dialogue", 3rd - 5th October 2014. The edition's theme was "Europe / Not Europe" and the title of my paper - "What is shared history".
profile_positions.title: Presenter, Closing Speech

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Youth Advisory Group
volunteer_experiences.description: EAVI – the European Association for Viewers Interests – is an  international non-profit organisation which advocates media literacy and full citizenship. The Youth Advisory Group participates in research projects analysing the connection between media literacy and active citizenship through the perspective of young people.
